name: Verwey, Albert/Vloten, Katharina van aan Verwey Jr., Christoffel | 1892-12-06

Transcription.text:
¶Haarlem. 6th Decr '92

Dear Saint,

Will you please tell me whether you bought both books at Mr van Kesterens. The case is that we possess allready The Light that failed, and Dreams we possess not, but would be very glad if we could get instead of the two one work we are extremely desirous to have, viz: Walter Crane's Claims of decorative art.
    If Dreams is bought elsewhere, we will ask Crane instead of Kipling and pay the surplus. Dear Saint, you have been by much too liberal this year and we can never be grateful enough. This paper on which I write - but I bethink myself that my thanks for that are not to be sent to the same address as this, though to nearly the same.

Believe us, dear Saint,
Your grateful and humble children
and servants
Albert & Kitty Verwey
¶
